Corn oil and its effects on breast cancer

Summary generated using: $shovel3 query.concatConclusions 'breast cancer corn oil site:ncbi.nlm.nih.gov' 40 includeReference=True
  • Consumption of EVOO in moderate quantities and throughout the lifetime appears to be a healthy choice and may favourably influence breast cancer risk.
    • Journal:
    • Date:
    • Link to article
  • The high-corn-oil diet strongly stimulates mammary tumorigenesis in association with modifications in the expression profile and an increased proliferation/apoptosis balance of the mammary gland.
    • Journal:
    • Date:
    • Link to article
  • These results indicate that a high-fat diet rich in omega-3 fatty acids can suppress human breast cancer cell growth and metastases in this mouse model system.
    • Journal:
    • Date:
    • Link to article
  • Substituting canola oil for corn oil is an easy dietary change for people to make; such a change to the maternal diet may decrease risk for breast cancer in the daughter.
    • Journal:
    • Date:
    • Link to article
  • The inhibitory effects of dietary fish oil on human breast cancer cell growth and metastasis in this model system are ascribable to its high eicosapentaenoic acid and docosahexaenoic acid content; the mechanism very likely involves suppression of tumor eicosanoid biosynthesis.
    • Journal:
    • Date:
